title: drop-tracking: ICE when using default struct update syntax

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Triaged
labels.description: Async-await issues that have been triaged during a working group meeting.

body:
cc https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/97331, @eholk. Minimized from https://crater-reports.s3.amazonaws.com/pr-97334/try%23615edd3ad1cf6871c977dc900317cb6c2070fd6b/gh/AsuMagic.markov-irc/log.txt in the crater run for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/97334. ### Code ```Rust fn main() { let _ = foo(); } async fn from_config(_: Config) {} async fn foo() { from_config(Config { nickname: None, ..Default::default() }) .await; } #[derive(Default)] struct Config { nickname: Option>, } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version`: 615edd3ad1cf6871c977dc900317cb6c2070fd6b ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/generator.rs:753:13: Broken MIR: generator contains type Config in MIR, but typeck only knows about {ResumeTy, impl Future, ()} and [] --> src/main.rs:7:16 | 7 | async fn foo() { | ________________^ 8 | | from_config(Config { 9 | | nickname: None, 10 | | ..Default::default() 11 | | }) 12 | | .await; 13 | | } | |_^ ```
Backtrace
